unnormalised: So, someone asked about the future of online learning in India, huh? Well, let me tell you a story. My cousin, Priya, she was prepping for her NEET exams. Kota coaching was out of the question - too expensive, plus the whole stress thing. She was getting anxious.
normalised: So, someone asked about the future of online learning in India, huh? Well, let me tell you a story. My cousin, Priya, she was prepping for her N-E-E-T exams. Kota coaching was out of the question - too expensive, plus the whole stress thing. She was getting anxious.

unnormalised: Then her friend told her about this EdTech platform, something like "NeetPrepPro" (not the actual name!). They offered live online classes, mock tests mimicking the actual NEET pattern and personalised mentorship, all for â‚¹25,000 a year. It was a steal compared to the 2 lakh+ the Kota institutes were charging. She started attending classes daily from 6:00 PM to 9:00 PM after her school. Even on Sundays she'd attend special doubt clearing sessions.
normalised: Then her friend told her about this E-D-Tech platform, something like "N-E-E-T-Prep-Pro" (not the actual name!). They offered live online classes, mock tests mimicking the actual N-E-E-T pattern and personalised mentorship, all for rupee twenty five thousand a year. It was a steal compared to the two lakh plus the Kota institutes were charging. She started attending classes daily from six p m to nine p m after her school. Even on Sundays she'd attend special doubt clearing sessions.

unnormalised: What really helped were the recorded lectures. She could replay them whenever she wanted. Plus, she could attend from her home in Guwahati, saving on travel and accommodation costs. And the tutors, most were IIT grads, very good at explaining stuff in Hinglish - which Priya found super helpful. Her score improved from 450/720 to 610/720 in mock tests.
normalised: What really helped were the recorded lectures. She could replay them whenever she wanted. Plus, she could attend from her home in Guwahati, saving on travel and accommodation costs. And the tutors, most were I-I-T grads, very good at explaining stuff in Hinglish - which Priya found super helpful. Her score improved from four hundred and fifty divided by seven hundred and twenty to six hundred and ten divided by seven hundred and twenty in mock tests.

unnormalised: Priya's now studying at a medical college in Kerala, all thanks to online learning. I think it's a game changer for students in smaller towns who don't have access to quality education. EdTech is the future, bhai! Just gotta make sure these platforms are legit and affordable.
normalised: Priya's now studying at a medical college in Kerala, all thanks to online learning. I think it's a game changer for students in smaller towns who don't have access to quality education. E-D-Tech is the future, bhai! Just gotta make sure these platforms are legit and affordable.
